bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: Kurt Wolff (1912-2003) was a sociologist who taught first at Ohio State University and then at Brandeis University. He began his studies at the University of Frankfurt in Germany during the early 1930s, but his work was interrupted by the Nazis' rise to power. After moving to to Italy, he obtained his Ph.D. from the University of Florence in 1935. Four years later, anti-Semitic laws again forced Wolff to leave and, in 1939, he relocated to the United States where he began his teaching and research career.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The collection contains hand–corrected typescripts of poetry (1937) and novels "Die Kügel" (1937) and "Organda" (1952) by Wolff.
The majority of Wolff's papers are held at Brandeis University where he taught for many years.

arrangement.head: Arrangement of the Collection
arrangement.p: The collection is unprocessed and is likely disorganized. Individual items may be difficult to find.
